title: Bailey's inside-the-park, walk-off HR 1st since '16
content: Patrick Bailey hit a three-run, inside-the-park home run with one out in the ninth inning, lifting the Giants over the Phillies on Tuesday night.

title: Clark, Collier draft All-Star teams, flip coaches
content: Caitlin Clark selected her two Indiana All-Star teammates in the draft to determine teams for the WNBA All-Star Game on July 19.

title: Ohtani takes Miz deep but phenom fans 12 in win
content: Shohei Ohtani greeted Jacob Misiorowski with a 431-foot leadoff homer Tuesday night, but the Milwaukee Brewers rookie phenom got the last laugh with a 12-strikeout night.

title: Mets' Mendoza: Snubbed Soto 'an All-Star for us'
content: The New York Mets consider Juan Soto an All-Star, despite the snub he received from those who selected the National League squad, but manager Carlos Mendoza told reporters Tuesday, "I'm hoping in the next couple of days we hear something and he makes it."

title: Sources: Jokic to delay extension talks until '26
content: Nikola Jokic will not seek a contract extension this summer, delaying extension talks until next summer, a source confirmed to ESPN.

title: Aces' Wilson exits with wrist injury; set for MRI
content: Reigning WNBA MVP A'ja Wilson missed the second half of the Aces' loss to the Liberty on Tuesday night after injuring her right wrist.

title: Ayton: Joining Doncic 'feels like a video game'
content: More than seven years after being drafted ahead of Luka Doncic, 2018 No. 1 pick Deandre Ayton was amazed Tuesday when considering the chance to team up with the superstar on the Los Angeles Lakers, telling reporters "this feels like a video game."

title: UCF's Frost: Nebraska job 'wasn't a good move'
content: At his first Big 12 football media days as UCF's coach, Scott Frost addressed his failed tenure at Nebraska on Tuesday, telling reporters, "I got tugged in a direction to try to help my alma mater and didn't really want to do it. It wasn't a good move."

title: Potential MLB trade proposals for Paul Skenes, Ronald Acuña Jr. and Byron Buxton
content: You won't be seeing these stars available via trade this year -- but what would it take to land them if they were?

title: Ranking all 32 NFL teams based on WR, RB and TE talent: Who's No. 1? Who's No. 32?
content: Which teams have the best skill position talent around their quarterback? We stacked all 32 from worst to first.

title: Should Minnesota, Houston or any West team scare OKC in 2025-26? We tiered all 15 franchises

title: Power Rankings: Storm up, Aces down and no time to panic for New York
content: The defending champ opened the season with nine straight wins. But it has lost six of the past nine games.

content: ESPN surveyed league executives, coaches and scouts to help us rank the top 10 players at 11 different positions, from quarterback to cornerback and everything in between.

title: Can rising American Taylor Fritz topple Carlos Alcaraz?
content: It's a tall order to say the least, but Fritz has a chance to be the first American man to make the Wimbledon final since 2009.

title: Inside the shift in evaluating MLB draft catching prospects
content: MLB's 2023 rules changes are influencing how the position is taught, played, coached, scouted at all levels.

title: With brace in his first start, João Pedro arrives in style to fire Chelsea into Club World Cup final
content: João Pedro showed why he might be just the player Chelsea needed, sending the Blues to the Club World Cup final by scoring both goals in a 2-0 win over Fluminense.

title: Why Mbappé, PSG reunion at Club World Cup will be must-see TV
content: Kylian Mbappé will meet his former club, PSG, on Wednesday in the Club World Cup semifinal. It'll be a fascinating reunion for many reasons, not least because of how PSG have grown without him.

content: Spanish soccer expert Graham Hunter followed the USMNT at the Gold Cup, and he saw the foundations being laid for Mauricio Pochettino's vision.

title: Euro 2025 Daily: Germany beat Denmark despite early wobbles
content: Germany had to come from behind to beat Denmark, but the win puts them into the quarterfinals. Here's everything you need to know about Euro 2025 action.

title: Chelsea's Pedro 'sorry' to knock out boyhood club
content: João Pedro kept the celebrations to a minimum after scoring twice to send Chelsea into the Club World Cup final, his goals proving the undoing of his former club Fluminense in a bittersweet meeting at MetLife Stadium on Tuesday.

title: Luis Enrique on Mbappé: Not discussing the 'past'
content: PSG coach Luis Enrique refused to discuss Kylian Mbappé ahead of Wednesday's Club World Cup semifinal with his former star's new club Real Madrid.

title: Police: Speeding could be factor in Jota crash
content: Spanish police believe Liverpool player Diogo Jota was driving over the speed limit when he and his brother died in a car crash last week.

title: United confirm Cunha as new No. 10 after Rashford
content: New Manchester United signing Matheus Cunha will wear the No. 10 shirt previously worn by Marcus Rashford, the Premier League club confirmed on Tuesday.

title: Source: Newcastle agree $75M deal for Elanga
content: Newcaslte have agreed a £55 million deal with Nottingham Forest for winger Anthony Elanga, a source has told ESPN.

title: Gaucho hopes CWC brings Brazil coaches respect
content: Fluminense's trip to the Club World Cup semifinal should net Brazilian coaches more respect, the club's manager Renato Portaluppi said on Tuesday, after their improbable deep run in the tournament ended in a 2-0 defeat to Chelsea.

title: Ex-Man Utd player Heinze added to Arteta's staff
content: Arsenal have added former Manchester United and Argentina defender Gabriel Heinze to manager Mikel Arteta's coaching staff, the club announced Monday.

title: Investigation clears Bay FC coach Montoya
content: An independent investigation found that Bay FC coach Albertin Montoya did not violate the National Women's Soccer League's antiharassment, discrimination and bullying policy, but found shortcomings in his communication style.

title: Texas Tech's tortillas and more updates to CFB 26 are shown through team accounts

title: T.N. CM Stalin pays tributes to Raja of Panagal on his birth anniversary

content: Vaishnavi, Hunar, Kanha, and Khesari went missing while playing outside their homes and were found dead in a water-filled pit in a nearby field

Namibia a ‘valued and trusted partner’ in Africa: PM Modi
as he arrives in Namibia
content: This is the first visit of Prime Minister Modi to Namibia and the third ever Prime Ministerial visit from India to the country

title: Bharat Bandh: Normal life hit in Kerala’s Ernakulam district
content: Shops and commercial establishments remained closed in the district. Public transport was also affected as private buses stayed off the roads. No untoward incidents were reported so far

content: In a different era, two prominent Indians— Mahatma Gandhi, Jawaharlal Nehru had been nominated for the Nobel Peace Prize, Congress said

title: Staying at home during COVID-19 to be treated as duty for trainees: Rail Ministry
content: The ministry's circular came after one of the Zonal Railways unit sought to know whether the period spent at home during nationwide lockdown due to pandemic be considered as duty also for the purpose of increments.

title: Harassing juniors through informal WhatsApp groups to be treated as ragging: UGC
content: Forcing students to cut their hair, stay awake for long hours or verbally humiliating them were cited as other common ragging practices

title: TTD suspends official for professing alien faith
content: The employees, while joining the TTD service, are required to take an oath and sign a declaration that they will follow the Hindu Dharma and practise Hindu traditions only

title: WaveX unveils 'Kalaa Setu' to tap AI startups for multilingual citizen outreach
content: Kalaa Setu aims to bridge the digital language divide by enabling public communication bodies to dynamically transform official information into regionally resonant formats such as infographic visuals, contextualised video explainers, and audio news capsules, in real time

title: TTD will adopt technology to ensure timely darshan for devotees, says EO
content: Option of QR code and facial recognition systems should be explored to ensure faster and accurate verification of devotees, suggests TTD EO Shyamala Rao

title: A.P. water users’ body hails Naidu’s vision to interlink Krishna and Godavari

title: How South Korea Is Dealing With Viral "Lovebug" Invasion
content: K-pop's BTS are grossed out by them. A YouTuber ate them. Hikers plough through them: South Korea is dealing with a "lovebug" invasion that experts say highlights worsening climate change.

title: June Was Hottest On Record In Western Europe: Climate Monitor
content: Western Europe sweltered through its hottest June on record last month, as "extreme" temperatures blasted the region in punishing back-to-back heatwaves, the EU climate monitor Copernicus said Wednesday.

title: "I'm Judo, Karate Champion": Sena MLA In Punch Video Says "Did No Wrong"
content: Far from feeling apologetic about publicly assaulting a canteen staff over food quality, Shiv Sena MLA Sanjay Gaikwad told NDTV that he had "no regrets" and that he was not just a lawmaker, but a "warrior" too.

title: Powerplay Moves To Delhi, Siddaramaiah, DK Shivakumar To Meet Rahul Gandhi
content: The suspense over the Karnataka Chief Minister post has shifted from Bengaluru to Delhi, with both Siddaramaiah and DK Shivakumar in the national capital to meet the Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge and senior party leader Rahul Gandhi

title: Ex-Pakistan Foreign Minister Fact-Checked On Terrorist's Funeral Photo
content: Pakistan's former Foreign Minister Hina Rabbani Khar faced an awkward and embarrassing moment on live television when she was fact-checked by a journalist for trying to portray a globally sanctioned terrorist as a "common man".

title: 10 Mexican Cartel Gunmen Sentenced To 141 Years In Prison
content: They were arrested at a ranch that authorities say was used as a forced recruitment centre for the Jalisco New Generation Cartel, one of Mexico's most powerful criminal gangs.

title: Teen Undergoing "Psychological Treatment" Kills Boy, 9, At Brazil School
content: A 16-year-old boy killed a child and injured two other people during an attack at a school in southern Brazil, authorities said Tuesday.

title: 9 Killed After Vehicles Fall Into River As Bridge Collapses In Gujarat
content: Nine people were killed and several vehicles fell into the Mahisagar (Mahi) River after a section of the Gambhira-Mujpur bridge in Padra taluka of Gujarat's Vadodara collapsed on Wednesday,

title: Texas Flood Deaths Rise To 109, Over 160 Still Missing
content: The state Governor said more than 160 people remain unaccounted for after devastating floods in Texas,  Tuesday, marking a dramatic increase in the number of missing from a tragedy that has so far claimed 109 lives.

title: Indian-Origin Sabih Khan Becomes Apple's Chief Operating Officer: All About Him
content: Sabih Khan, an Indian American techie, has been appointed as the new Chief Operating Officer (COO) of Apple Inc. Mr Khan, will succeed Jeff Williams as COO later this month. He's currently the Vice-President of the company.

title: UP Man Kills Father, Sister With Metal Rod And Bricks Over Property Dispute
content: A man allegedly killed his elderly father and sister by hitting them with a metal rod and bricks following a dispute over property.

title: "Are You Still Talking About Epstein?" Trump Lashes Out At Reporter
content: US President Donald Trump on Tuesday lashed out at a reporter after he asked US Department of Justice Special Counsel Pam Bondi about convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

title: UAE Debunks Reports Of Rs 23 Lakh Lifetime Dubai Golden Visa
content: The United Arab Emirates (UAE) has debunked recent reports claiming Dubai was planning to grant lifetime Golden Visas to certain nationalities.

title: Strange Case Of Evgeniya Mayboroda: Putin's Fan In Prison For Opposing Ukraine War
content: Evgeniya Mayboroda -- who comes from the Rostov region bordering Ukraine -- was accused of sharing "false information" on the Russian army on social media.

content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi arrived in Namibia on Wednesday on the final leg of his five-nation visit, during which he will hold bilateral talks with President Netumbo Nandi-Ndaitwah.

title: Indian-Origin Doctor In UK Suspended For Forcing Mother To Have Baby Using Forceps
content: Premila Thampi, from Mitcham in South London, allegedly bullied the patient into accepting forceps-assisted delivery.

title: "Your Mother Will Sell You": Father Hides Daughter For 7 Years In China
content: A Chinese father allegedly kept his daughter from meeting her mother, his ex-wife, for at least seven years. He moved across the country during this time period, tricking his daughter into thinking that if her mother found out, she would sell her.

title: Delhi-Bound Indigo Flight Returns To Patna After Technical Snag Due To Bird Hit
content: A Delhi-bound IndiGo flight carrying around 175 passengers returned to Jayaprakash Narayan International Airport in Patna after takeoff on Wednesday morning as one of its engines developed a technical snag due to a bird hit, airport officials said.

title: "Hindi Bolunga": Rickshaw Driver's Heated Exchange With Biker In Maharashtra
content: A heated exchange between two migrants in Maharashtra's Virar has gone viral on social media. The confrontation, captured on camera, shows a rickshaw driver and a bike rider engaged in a roadside argument.

title: How a high-level panel laid the blueprint for inclusive Archaka appointments to Tamil Nadu’s HR&CE temples
content: In 2006, the M. Karunanidhi government issued an order allowing any Hindu, regardless of caste, to become an Archaka in temples administered by the HR&CE department, provided they had the required training. To implement this order, it constituted a seven-member high-level committee on June 10, 2006, under the chairmanship of Justice (Retired) A.K. Rajan

content: What is about to unfold in Bihar is a fundamental disruption of India’s electoral democracy, with millions of second grade and insecure citizens

title: Jane Street row: Congress says ₹44,000 crore of ordinary investors siphoned off to U.S. under government’s nose
content: Congress spokesperson Supriya Shrinate questions what regulatory institutions and Ministers, including the PM, were doing while the American hedge fund was ‘robbing Indian investors’. The ₹44,000 cr. figure is only for a two-year period and the total amount could be much more as the firm has operated here for five years, she says

title: PM Modi conferred with Brazil's highest civilian award
content: The honour was presented by Brazilian President in recognition of PM Modi's notable contributions in enhancing India-Brazil cooperation across key global platforms

title: Tejashwi Yadav accuses ECI of forgery in the name of SIR
content: Raising questions on SIR, Tejashwi Yadav said that voter’s revision campaign 2025, conducted by the ECI in Bihar is plagued with disorder, chaos, and unconstitutional practices, which are highly condemnable and dangerous for democracy

title: Vadodara: Several vehicles plunge into river after bridge collapses; 9 killed
content: A portion of the Gambhira Bridge in Gujarat's Vadodara district collapsed on Wednesday morning, resulting in nine fatalities and at least 10 injuries. The incident occurred on the Padra–Mujpur stretch, a crucial link between Central Gujarat and Saurashtra. A truck, van, and car plunged into the Mahisagar River after the bridge gave way.

title: ‘Had to answer in my own style’: Sena MLA defends thrashing canteen worker; blames 'stale food'
content: Shiv Sena MLA Sanjay Gaikwad is under scrutiny after allegedly assaulting canteen staff at the Akashwani MLA hostel in Colaba due to being served substandard food. Gaikwad claimed the dal and rice were rotten, leading to his violent outburst, captured in a viral video. This incident adds to Gaikwad's history of controversial behavior and inflammatory remarks.

title: 'Bihar Bandh': Rahul, Tejashwi lead Mahagathbandhan protest over EC’s voter roll move;
content: Rahul Gandhi and Tejashwi Yadav led a "chakka jam" in Bihar, protesting the Election Commission's electoral roll revision ahead of assembly elections. The Grand Alliance march faced opposition from the BJP, who accused them of hooliganism and defended the EC's standard procedure.

title: Bharat Bandh: Trade unions stage nationwide strike; why are they protesting and what they're demanding
content: Ten central trade unions initiated a nationwide strike, Bharat Bandh, impacting banking, postal services, electricity, mining, and public transport across India. The unions, backed by agricultural organizations, protest against the government's labor and economic policies, claiming they favor corporate interests.

title: RJD's Manoj Jha accuses EC of backing out of scheduled meet; poll body responds
content: The Election Commission (EC) refuted RJD MP Manoj Jha's allegations regarding a cancelled meeting concerning Bihar's electoral roll revision. The EC clarified that Jha's authorization was limited and no communication was received from key RJD leaders.

title: US Air Force halts SpaceX project; Reason same as why Elon Musk skipped omelette …
content: The U.S. Air Force has suspended its plan to collaborate with SpaceX for hypersonic rocket cargo deliveries from Johnston Atoll due to environmental concerns. Biologists and experts feared the project would endanger numerous seabirds nesting on the remote Pacific wildlife refuge.

title: UAE Golden Visa: Has a Rs 23 lakh special visa been launched? Officials respond
content: Reports of a new UAE golden visa pilot program, particularly for Indian nationals with a lifetime visa for AED 100,000, have been dismissed by UAE authorities. The ICP clarified that Golden Visa requirements are explicitly outlined in official regulations, accessible through their digital platforms.

title: 'Let film be released': SC rejects urgent hearing on 'Udaipur Files'
content: The Supreme Court has declined an urgent hearing regarding a plea to halt the screening of 'Udaipur Files,' a film centered on the Kanhaiya Lal murder. The Delhi High Court, however, has instructed producers to arrange a screening for petitioners seeking a ban, citing concerns about hate speech. The film is based on the 2022 murder of tailor Kanhaiya Lal.

title: 1,000 new trains in 5 yrs; bullet train project on track - Railways' big plans
content: Indian Railways is set for a major overhaul, with plans to introduce 1,000 new trains in five years and launch bullet train services by 2027. The government aims to boost capacity, cut costs, and improve passenger experience, investing heavily in infrastructure and manufacturing.

title: What Chinese govt’s ‘leave India’ instruction to Foxconn engineers may mean for Apple
content: Foxconn has recalled over 300 Chinese engineers from its Indian iPhone plants, raising concerns about production. However, the company is replacing them with Taiwanese and Vietnamese experts, ensuring iPhone 17 production remains on track. Despite geopolitical tensions impacting supply chains, Apple's Indian operations are booming, targeting 60 million units this year and solidifying India's role in its global strategy.

title: Rods in hands, fury on display: MNS workers go on rampage at Washim toll booth - watch
content: MNS workers vandalized the Tondgaon toll plaza in Washim district, Maharashtra, due to ongoing roadwork and lack of amenities. The party's district president, Raju Patil Kidse, justified the action, stating that repeated complaints about the unfinished road leading to Kanergaon and the absence of basic facilities at the plaza had been ignored, despite toll collection commencing.

title: From Trump to Kash Patel to Bondi: How Epstein files have left MAGA floundering
content: The MAGA movement faces scrutiny over Jeffrey Epstein conspiracy theories. A justice department memo debunked claims of a client list and murder. Trump allies like Pam Bondi and Kash Patel are retracting or contradicting past statements. Bondi's remarks about a client list and videos are now disputed. Patel's claims of a cover-up are resurfacing. Trump defended Bondi, dismissing Epstein questions.

title: Is Steve Bannon in Epstein files? Elon Musk's big claim raises questions; netizens react
content: Elon Musk and Steve Bannon are embroiled in a public feud, escalating after Musk alleged Bannon's name appears in the Jeffrey Epstein files. This claim followed Roger Stone's questioning of Bannon's meetings with Epstein post-conviction. Bannon retaliated by calling for an investigation into Musk's immigration status and his deportation from the United States.

title: Elon Musk reacts as Bill Gates again raises alarm on USAID funding cut killing children
content: Bill Gates expressed concerns over potential health aid cuts by the US government, warning of increased deaths. Elon Musk responded sharply, suggesting Gates' unhappiness stemmed from his organization losing US taxpayer funding. This exchange is the latest in a series of disagreements, fueled by Gates' past short position against Tesla stock, which reportedly cost him $1.5 billion.

title: PM Modi receives ceremonial welcome in Namibia; tries hands at playing traditional drums
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi concluded his five-nation tour with a visit to Namibia, receiving a ceremonial welcome and engaging with traditional Namibian culture. This marks his first visit to Namibia, where he will hold bilateral talks with President Netumbo Nandi-Ndaitwah and pay respects to the country's Founding Father, Dr. Sam Nujoma.

title: ‘100 per cent’: Elon Musk says his America Party will expose Epstein files
content: Elon Musk has declared that exposing the Jeffrey Epstein files will be a "top priority" for his new political venture, the America Party, escalating his feud with Donald Trump. Musk questioned Trump's credibility, demanding the release of the files. This comes after the DOJ and FBI concluded Epstein was not murdered and had no blackmail list, despite Musk's previous claims.

title: Hindu nationalism, tribal identity, Pakistan: What DU doesn’t want you to study anymore
content: Delhi University is set to remove several critical texts from its postgraduate Political Science and History syllabi, including works by Christophe Jaffrelot and Amita Baviskar. The proposed changes, which follow the exclusion of courses on Pakistan and China, have sparked concerns over political influence and shrinking academic freedom under the guise of curriculum restructuring.

title: Leafs blasted for downgrade as Nino Niederreiter eyed to replace Marner
content: Following Mitch Marner's departure, the Toronto Maple Leafs are reportedly considering acquiring veteran winger Nino Niederreiter from the Winnipeg Jets. Niederreiter's physicality and playoff experience align with Coach Craig Berube's vision for a tougher team. The potential trade could involve Nick Robertson or Bobby McMann heading to Winnipeg, addressing their need for winger depth after losing Nikolaj Ehlers.

title: Cardi B, Stefon Diggs squash breakup rumors with surprise workout video
content: Rumors floated that Cardi B and Stefon Diggs broke up. Cardi B deleted Diggs' photos from Instagram. She also posted a cryptic message. But Stefon Diggs posted a YouTube video. Cardi B was in the video. They were working out together. This surprised fans. People think it was a publicity stunt. Some believe it was a brief fight.

title: Kelcey Wetterberg leaves Cowboys Cheer fame to focus on nursing and family
content: Kelcey Wetterberg, recognized from 'America’s Sweethearts' and a five-year Dallas Cowboys Cheerleader veteran, has transitioned to full-time nursing after marrying Nate Crnkovich in late 2024. Wetterberg balanced cheerleading with her nursing career, often working long hours. While stepping back from the cheerleading squad, she remains connected as an 'All-Star,' supporting the team.

title: Netanyahu says talks with Trump focused on hostage release; vows to eliminate Hamas
content: During his US visit, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu affirmed commitment to freeing Gaza hostages and eliminating Hamas' capabilities. He lauded the unprecedented US-Israel ties under President Trump, highlighting their joint operation against Iran as a "great victory.

title: Smriti Irani: There’s nothing that television can throw at me that politics hasn’t
content: Smriti Irani is making a comeback to television with the reboot of 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi,' reprising her iconic role as Tulsi Virani. She emphasizes that returning to the show feels like reuniting with family, focusing on the emotional connection rather than just appearances. Read Smriti Irani's interview.

title: Mid-air scare: Delhi-bound IndiGo flight hit by bird; makes emergency landing in Patna
content: An IndiGo flight, 6E 5009, en route to Delhi, made an emergency landing in Patna on Wednesday morning due to a bird strike. The Airbus A320 (VT-IFL) took off from Patna at 9:41 am but was forced to return shortly after takeoff.

title: Why Russia blacklisted Yale University? Hint: There’s a Navalny angle to this
content: Russia has declared Yale University an "undesirable organization," alleging its involvement in undermining Russia's territorial integrity and destabilizing its economy. Moscow accuses Yale of training anti-Kremlin activists, including associates of Alexei Navalny, and supporting efforts to seize frozen Russian assets for Ukraine's military. This designation prohibits Yale from operating in Russia and threatens its affiliates with criminal charges.

title: Bharat Bandh today: Trade unions stage nationwide strike; rail tracks blocked in Jadavpur
content: Ten central trade unions have called for a nationwide strike, Bharat Bandh, on Wednesday, supported by rural and agricultural labor organizations. The unions are protesting government policies favoring big businesses at the expense of workers and farmers. They are demanding better wages, more government jobs, and opposing new labor codes, potentially disrupting public transport and services.

title: 'No regrets': Sena MLA thrashes canteen worker over alleged poor food quality; watch
content: Sanjay Gaikwad, a Shiv Sena MLA, is facing criticism after a video surfaced showing him assaulting a canteen worker. Priyanka Chaturvedi, a Rajya Sabha MP, shared the video and criticized Gaikwad's actions. Gaikwad defended his behavior, stating he has no regrets and would repeat it if necessary.

title: IND vs ENG 3rd Test: Workload or lack of support?
content: Jasprit Bumrah's workload management has sparked debate, contrasting with Kapil Dev's era. Despite concerns, Bumrah has bowled extensively since his return, raising questions about potential burnout. While Cummins and Starc also endure heavy workloads, Mohammed Siraj's remarkable contribution often goes unnoticed, highlighting the imbalance in India's pace attack and the need for broader support to prevent injuries.

title: IND vs ENG 3rd Test: Upbeat Bumrah goes through the paces at Lord's
content: Ahead of the third Test at Lord's, Jasprit Bumrah fine-tuned his bowling with subtle adjustments to his run-up, focusing on easing the load on his body. After being wicketless in the previous Test, Bumrah appeared upbeat, benefiting from workload management and the strong performances of fellow pacers Mohammed Siraj and Akash Deep.

title: 'May have implications on India's stability': CDS warns of China-Pak-Bangladesh axis; watch
content: CDS General Anil Chauhan cautioned that growing cooperation between China, Pakistan, and Bangladesh could destabilize India's security. He highlighted economic vulnerabilities in the Indian Ocean Region exploited by external powers. Gen Chauhan also referenced Operation Sindoor, a military conflict with Pakistan, emphasizing its global lessons.

title: Football: Jota possibly driving the Lamborghini above speed limit, says Spanish Police
content: Liverpool forward Diogo Jota and his brother Andre Silva tragically died in a car crash in Spain. The accident occurred when their Lamborghini veered off the road and caught fire. Spanish police are investigating the cause, focusing on excessive speed and tire marks, with a final report pending submission to the local court.

title: 'I stay in Delhi for two or three days only,' says Nitin Gadkari; explains why
content: Union minister Nitin Gadkari voiced concerns about Delhi's escalating pollution, impacting public health and life expectancy. Speaking at 'Ek Ped Maa Ke Naam 2.0' tree plantation drive, he emphasised the urgent need to curb vehicle emissions. Gadkari highlighted government initiatives promoting alternative fuels like ethanol, large-scale plantation drives, and utilising waste in road construction.

title: Price prediction: Where is gold rate headed & is silver a better bet right now?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are expected to remain range-bound due to easing geopolitical tensions and optimism surrounding potential US trade deals, with a tariff deadline extension to August 1, 2025. Silver is emerging as a preferred investment option over gold, supported by rising Silver-backed ETFs.

title: IND vs ENG: Ashwin questions Stokes' batting credentials - 'Barring that...'
content: R Ashwin has launched a strong critique against Ben Stokes' batting approach, questioning his achievements beyond the Headingley Ashes innings. Ashwin dissected Stokes' dismissal in the Edgbaston Test, highlighting technical flaws and criticizing England's aggressive mindset. He slammed England's attempt to chase 608 runs on the final day, deeming it 'hara-kiri' and a mockery of Test cricket.

title: Alia Bhatt’s ex-assistant arrested for duping actress of over Rs 76 lakh
content: Alia Bhatt's ex-PA, Vedika Prakash Shetty, faces arrest for allegedly defrauding the actress of Rs 76.9 lakh. Juhu Police apprehended Shetty in Bengaluru following a complaint filed by Alia's mother, Soni Razdan. Shetty, who served as Alia's PA from 2021 to 2024, is accused of forging signatures. The court has remanded her in police custody until July 10.

title: 'I just coloured my beard two days ago... ': Virat Kohli breaks silence on Test retirement
content: Yuvraj Singh's YouWeCan Foundation gala dinner in London saw a gathering of cricket legends, including Sachin Tendulkar, Chris Gayle, and the Indian cricket team led by Gautam Gambhir. Virat Kohli made a surprise appearance, reminiscing about his Test retirement and praising Ravi Shastri's crucial support during his career.

title: Neena Gupta on first husband; says she never felt love like in movies or books
content: Neena Gupta reminisced about her early romances. Her first love was an IIT student, whom she married. College friends were jealous of her modern outlook. A movie date plan went awry due to parental restrictions. Neena reflected on never experiencing the cinematic kind of love. She admitted to falling madly for someone, but a relationship was impossible.

title: Shubman Gill mirrors Virat Kohli's career: From U-19 to Test captaincy records
content: Shubman Gill's career path shows striking similarities to Virat Kohli's. Both excelled in Under-19 World Cups and achieved centuries across all formats. They reached top ODI rankings and demonstrated consistent batting. Gill and Kohli share uncanny parallels in IPL performances and Test achievements. These coincidences highlight Gill's potential to inspire future cricketers, much like Kohli.

title: ‘Guardian of our jungles’: Asia’s oldest female elephant dies; was over 100 years old
content: Vatsala, believed to be Asia's oldest female elephant at over 100 years, passed away at Panna Tiger Reserve, Madhya Pradesh. Chief Minister Mohan Yadav paid tribute to Vatsala, highlighting her role as a guardian of the forests and a symbol of the state's emotions. The elephant, brought from Kerala, was cremated with full honors.

title: New Mexico floods: Houses swept away, river overflows as rain hits Ruidoso village - watch
content: Ruidoso, New Mexico, faced devastating flash floods, sweeping away homes and stranding residents. Emergency crews performed 85 swift-water rescues as floodwaters submerged roads and entered homes. The Rio Ruidoso surged nearly 19 feet, prompting warnings for residents to seek higher ground. The area, vulnerable due to prior wildfires, experienced even higher floodwaters than last summer, impacting previously unaffected areas.

title: 'Had to come out alive': Himachal woman survives 5 hours under landslide debris
content: In Himachal's Mandi district, Tuneja Thakur, a 20-year-old woman, displayed incredible resilience after being buried in a landslide. For five hours, she clawed through mud and debris, creating a breathing space and digging her way out. Her determination to survive amidst the devastating flash floods has been hailed as a miracle, with officials praising her courage.

title: Dayton Bramhall cut again — legacy Disney daughter’s emotional Netflix journey
content: Dayton Bramhall, daughter of Shelly, faced challenges in her DCC journey. She auditioned thrice but was cut each time. Despite her family's DCC legacy, she needed to earn her place. The rejection strained relationships, especially with her mother. Dayton now teaches at The Young Company in Texas. She empowers young dancers with her experiences.

title: Colin Kaepernick: 'I'm not quitting'—daily training for NFL comeback
content: Colin Kaepernick, now 37, declares his readiness to return to the NFL after an eight-year absence. Despite last playing in 2017, he maintains a rigorous training schedule and believes he can still be a starting quarterback. Kaepernick awaits an opportunity, remaining optimistic that the right team will call, even after years away from the game.

title: Russell Wilson’s wife Ciara rocks ‘classic’ pink Adidas outfit - seals style icon status
content: Ciara recently captivated fans with a retro-inspired look, sporting a pink Adidas tracksuit and debuting a striking new hairstyle, drawing admiration from her husband, Russell Wilson. The singer has been making fashion headlines, from Knicks games to London trips. Simultaneously, Ciara is gearing up for her album release, 'CiCi,' on August 22, featuring collaborations with Normani and Teyana Taylor.

title: IND vs ENG: England ka koi ego vego nahi hai? R Ashwin blasts 'Bazballers'
content: Indian spinner R Ashwin has criticized Brendon McCullum's 'Bazball' coaching approach, arguing its New Zealand-centric style is failing England. Ashwin highlights the differences between New Zealand and England pitches, emphasizing the importance of seam and swing in England.

title: Are heart palpitations dangerous? Here's what we know
content: Heart palpitations feel like your heart is racing, fluttering, pounding, or skipping beats. You might notice these sensations in your chest, throat, or neck. They can happen during physical activity or even when you are resting. They usually last for a few seconds to minutes, but can sometimes last longer.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for today - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Mehul Kothari from Anand Rathi Shares recommends buying AAVAS Financiers, citing a strong base formation and potential breakout towards ₹2300. He also suggests Jyothy Labs due to a double bottom confirmation and possible retest of ₹400 levels. Additionally, Varun Beverages Limited is recommended for an oversold bounce with a target of ₹490.

title: Divisional rankings: Which fighter replaces Catterall?
content: welterweight boxer Jack Catterall won his debut by technical decision over Harlem Eubank . a cut caused by a clash of heads ended the fight prematurely . his departure from 140 pounds makes room for dalton Smith to enter the rankings at No. 10 .

title: 'Gift of this new little life': Tim Tebow and wife Demi-Leigh welcome newborn daughter
content: daphne Reign Tebow's middle name is inspired by a young girl they admire . "we couldn't be more grateful for the blessing and gift of this new little life," he wrote . the couple announced the birth of their daughter in a joint Instagram post .

title: Final 2025 MLB draft rankings: Which college ace is No. 1 in our top 250 prospects?
content: I've updated my overall minor league top 100 rankings to make adjustments and remove graduated players so you can see roughly where the top players in the draft would slot on that list . this year's class is highlighted by a group of college left-handed pitchers near the top of the rankings .

title: Who won the men's hoops transfer portal, according to Dick Vitale
content: nearly 2,700 players jumped into the portal this year -- roughly 2,300 from d-I men's basketball alone . the nation's no. 3 scorer averaged 21.7 points last year, leaving Memphis, and Manhattan, Kansas . he can light up, create turnovers and disrupt passing lanes .

title: 2025 MLB draft guide: One big question and latest intel for all 30 teams
content: this year's draft will take place July 13-14 in Atlanta as part of major league baseball's all-Star Game festivities hosted by the Atlanta Braves . a big question facing each of the 30 MLB teams is whether the Nats opt for LSU lefty Kade Anderson over Ethan Holliday .

content: the ACC crown has gone to either Dabo Swinney's Clemson Tigers or to someone who managed to beat them in the regular season . over the past 10 of those 14 years, the ac has won eight titles . last year they became the first bid thief of the expanded College Football Playoff era .

title: Nine players who will score more TDs in 2025
content: 169 instances in which a wide receiver or tight end scored fewer than five touchdowns on 50-plus offensive touches before managing at least 50 touches the very next season . of those 169, 114 (67.5%) scored more touchdowns the next season, focusing in on the 48 players in that group who scored less than three touchdowns during the first year .

title: NHL free agency tracker: Updated list of the summer signings
content: a slew of re-signings and the trade of Mitch Marner took several big names off the free agent big board . the 2025 draft included 224 prospects finding new homes, and the weekend included trades for Noah Dobson , Charlie Coyle and John Gibson .

title: 'Tough love' coaching style prompts abuse concerns on Stanford's water polo team
content: the battle over Flacks' coaching style centers on what constitutes "tough love" versus "toxic" behavior . one faction blames the controversy on parental interference, players' dissatisfaction over playing time and an inability to cope with the rigors of collegiate play .

title: Who dropped out of the top 10? Players eyeing a bounce-back at 11 positions
content: sportsmail's survey of the top 10 players at every position is unveiled . ranked candidates based on top-10 votes, composite average and interviews . more than 70 voters submitted a ballot on at least one position, and in many cases all positions .

title: Three years into Boehly's ownership, Chelsea's transfers still don't make sense
content: despite spending €630 million on transfer fees across both windows, the team finished in the bottom half of the premier league table . the next phase, in the summer of 2023: same thing, but young guys . this led to a bunch of signings of players such as Raheem Sterling and Kalidou Koulibaly .

title: A'ja Wilson, Josh Allen among 2025 ESPYS candidates; vote now
content: the 2025 ESPYS presented by Capital One are July 16 . the Oklahoma City Thunder guard is nominated in two categories: Best Athlete - Men's Sports, and Best NBA Player . Simone Biles and Sydney McLaughlin-Levrone are up for best . Ilona Maher and Ezra Frech represent in both categories .

title: The good, the bad and the ugly among 2025's first-half relief pitching performances
content: relief pitchers have defined the 2025 season so far . he enters the final week before the break dominating scoring among relief peers . the lone pitchers ahead of him are Detroit Tigers LHP Tarik Skubal and Philadelphia Phillies RHP Zack Wheeler .

title: WNBA All-Star roster revealed: Which players got snubbed?
content: the 2025 WNBA All-Star Game reserves were announced Sunday . the 22 players selected for the July 19 game represent 12 of the 13 teams . a week ago the starters were released by fan, player and media balloting .

title: 🏒 From A+ to D+: Grading NHL offseasons
content: the compressed offseason is an opportunity for every front office to improve its roster . some general managers need just a few players to remain a top Stanley Cup contender . others need to be a bit more aggressive to raise their club's competitive level .

title: MLB GMs tell their best (and wildest) trade stories
content: baseball general manager Eugenio Suarez could be a top target at the trade deadline . a major league baseball team is always willing to do a deal, but that doesn't mean they're going to go unanswered . baseball executives asked them to tell us their favorite trade stories .
